adjective.description: Of, relating to, or characteristic of Notker Balbulus or his works, which religious and moral writings include the Liber Hymnorum, the earliest compilation of sequences for the Latin mass.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in Encyclopaedia Britannica. From the name of NotkerBalbulus (840–912), monk and scholar of St Gall, Switzerland + -ian.
